quotation.p: She lets her knowledge out a bit at a time, so as not to embarrass me.
quotation.source: Ian, talking about Susan, in "An Unearthly Child"

quotation.p: Don't you think you're being rather high-handed, young man? You thought you saw a young girl enter the yard, you imagine you heard her voice, you believe she might be in there. Not very substantial, is it?
quotation.source: The Doctor, to Ian, in "An Unearthly Child"

quotation.p: I tolerate this century but I don't enjoy it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "An Unearthly Child"

quotation.p: Have you ever thought what it's like, to be wanderers in the fourth dimension? Have you? To be exiles?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "An Unearthly Child"

quotation.p: Your arrogance is nearly as great as your ignorance.
quotation.source: The Doctor, to Ian, in "An Unearthly Child"

quotation.p: There is no indignity in being afraid to die, but there is a terrible shame in being afraid to live.
quotation.source: Alydon, in "The Daleks"

quotation.p: I'm afraid we have no time for codes and manners.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Edge of Destruction"

quotation.p: A rash action is worse than no action at all.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Edge of Destruction"

quotation.p: "Frankly Doctor, I find it hard to keep pace with you."
"You mean 'to keep one jump ahead'; that you will never be!"
quotation.source: Ian and the Doctor, in "The Edge of Destruction"

quotation.p: It was your instincts and intuition against my logic, and you succeeded.
quotation.source: The Doctor, to Barbara, in "The Edge of Destruction"

quotation.p: "You know, I acquired that ulster from Gilbert and Sullivan."
"Oh, really? I thought it was made for two."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ian, in "The Edge of Destruction"

quotation.p: "Perhaps it's frozen."
"No, impossible... not in this temperature. Besides, it's too warm."
quotation.source: Barbara and the Doctor, in "The Keys of Marinus"

quotation.p: "What's that awful noise?"
"I beg your pardon... 'Awful noise'? A good way to talk about my singing!"
"No, Doctor, not that awful noise -- the other one!"
quotation.source: Barbara and the Doctor, in "The Chase"

quotation.p: "Where's your spirit of adventure, hm?"
"It died a slow and painful death when those bats came out of the rafters."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ian, in "The Chase"

quotation.p: You know, I am so constantly outwitting the opposition, I tend to forget the delight and satisfaction of the arts... the gentle art of fisticuffs.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Romans"

quotation.p: One day I shall come back. Yes, I shall come back. Until then, there must be no regrets, no tears, no anxieties. Just go forward in all your beliefs, and prove to me that I am not mistaken in mine. Goodbye, Susan.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Dalek Invasion of Earth"

quotation.p: That is the dematerializing control. And that, over yonder, is the horizontal hold. Up there is the scanner, those are the doors, that is a chair with a panda on it. Sheer poetry, dear boy. Now please stop bothering me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Time Meddler"

quotation.p: "What do you think of that, now, eh? A Viking helmet."
"Maybe."
"What do you mean, 'maybe'? What do you think it is, a space helmet for a cow?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Steven, in "The Time Meddler"

quotation.p: "Why do you suppose they're fighting?"
"I haven't the remotest idea, my boy. No doubt their reasons will be entirely adequate."
quotation.source: Steven and the Doctor, in "The Myth Makers"

quotation.p: Who am I to fear the thunder, you superstitious dark dodging decadent?
quotation.source: Hector, in "The Myth Makers"

quotation.p: "How dare you? I am high priestess of Troy!"
"All right, then, get back to your temple before you give us all galloping religious mania!"
quotation.source: Cassandra and Paris, in "The Myth Makers"

quotation.p: "You see, I'm treated with more respect by the enemy than I am by my own family."
"They don't know you as well as we do."
quotation.source: Paris and Cassandra, in "The Myth Makers"

quotation.p: "It must be about the year 2050, Ben"
"We've got a proper Rip van Winkle here. <general laughter> It's 2070, in case you'd like to know."
"There you are. I was only 20 years out."
"Well, before we all forget what century we're in, I'd better tell you why I've called you here."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Hobson, in "The Moonbase"

quotation.p: There are some corners of the universe which have bred the most terrible things. Things which act against everything that we believe in. They must be fought.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Moonbase"

quotation.p: "You will now take us to the control center."
"I'll be damned if..." <is surrounded by Cybermen> "It's through here."
quotation.source: A Cyberman and Hobson, in "The Moonbase"

quotation.p: "How do you know?"
"I don't know, I'm guessing."
quotation.source: Jamie and the Doctor, in "The Macra Terror"

quotation.p: I can stand an operation on its head quicker than anyone.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Macra Terror"

quotation.p: Bad laws were made to be broken.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Macra Terror"

quotation.p: Logic, my dear Zoe, merely enables one to be wrong with authority.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Wheel in Space"

quotation.p: Your leader will be angry if you kill me; I'm a genius!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Seeds of Death"

quotation.p: You could augment an earwig to the point where it understood nuclear physics, but it would still be a very stupid thing to do!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: The universe should be big enough for the both of us ... just.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "Look at him! He's got 'archaeologist' written all over him!"
"Really? Does it show?"
quotation.source: Viner and the Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: "You look very nice in that dress, Victoria."
"Thank you. You don't think it's a bit, uh --"
"A bit short? Oh, I wouldn't worry about that. Look at Jamie's."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Victoria, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: Do not raise your voice. You will achieve nothing by shouting.
quotation.source: Kaftan, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: "Yes, yes, I can see that, but how did you know in the first place?"
"Oh, I use my own special technique."
"Oh, really, Doctor? And may we know what that is?"
"Keeping my eyes open and my mouth shut."
quotation.source: Klieg and The Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: I love to see the experts at work, don't you?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: If you take the sum of the integrates [sic] and express the results as a power series, then the interstices show the basic binary blocks, although I wouldn't do it if I were you.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: Your struggle is futile.
quotation.source: The Cybercontroller, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: Our lives are different from anybody else's. That's the exciting thing. Nobody in the universe can do what we're doing!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: "The power cable generated an electrical field and confused their tiny metal minds. You might almost say they had a complete metal breakdown."
<wincing> "Oooh."
"I'm so sorry."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Jamie, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: "He's fortunate. I spared him."
"You mean you missed him."
quotation.source: Klieg and Jamie, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: When I say run, run!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Tomb of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: My dear Miss Shaw, I never "report myself" anywhere.. particularly not "forthwith".
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Silurians"

quotation.p: "It bombards atoms with subatomic particles."
"Why?"
quotation.source: Dr. Lawrence and the Doctor, in "The Silurians"

quotation.p: "I take it you're yet another member of the UNIT team?"
"Yes. Depressing, isn't it?"
quotation.source: Dr. Meredith and the Doctor, in "The Silurians"

quotation.p: "This is the permanent undersecretary."
"Yes, well, I've got no time to chat to undersecretaries, permanent or otherwise."
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Silurians"

quotation.p: "You were a respected scientist once."
"Grossly underpaid."
quotation.source: Liz Shaw and the traitorous Dr. Lennox, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: I can also withstand considerably more G-force than most people, even though I do say so myself.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: Didn't you find two angry men stuck to my car?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: "The only people who could set this up would be foreign agents with enormous resources."
"And hair combs."
quotation.source: Gen. Carrington and the Doctor, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: "Don't try anything."
"It's all right; I won't hurt you."
quotation.source: Unnamed thug and Liz Shaw, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: "Control to capsule: do you have visual contact?"
"Do you mean 'Can I see it'?"
quotation.source: Cornish and the Doctor, in "The Ambassadors of Death"

quotation.p: "Now look, this is a government project, right?"
"Right."
"So now I'm a sort of temporary civil servant."
"Broadly speaking, yes. How do you like the idea?"
"No comment."
quotation.source: Sutton and Sir Keith, in "Inferno"

quotation.p: Mind you, I'm not wild about computers myself, but they are a tool. If you have a tool, it's stupid not to use it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Inferno"

quotation.p: "But I don't exist in your world!"
"Then you won't feel the bullets when we shoot you."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Brigade Leader, in "Inferno"

quotation.p: "You are giving us a great deal of trouble."
"I'm delighted to hear that."
quotation.source: The Brigade Leader and the Doctor, in "Inferno"

quotation.p: "I'm your new assistant."
"Oh, no."
quotation.source: Jo Grant and the Doctor, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "I thought you said you took science at A level."
"I didn't say I passed."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Jo Grant, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: What the blazes are you doing in here? Don't you know this area is strictly off-limits to everybody except the tea lady and the Brigadier's personal staff?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: Oh, by the way, talking of eggs, I want a four-hour scan below the hydrogen line tomorrow; I'll give you the precise wavelength later.
quotation.source: One of the astronomers, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: Nonsense; what you need, as Ms Shaw herself so often remarked, is someone to pass you your test tubes and tell you how brilliant you are. Miss Grant will fulfill that function admirably.
quotation.source: The Brigadier to the Doctor, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "I'm travelling incognito."
"Oh? Why?"
"We Time Lords don't care to be conspicuous." <looks at the Doctor> "Some of us, that is."
quotation.source: The unnamed Time Lord, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: That jackanapes! All he ever does is cause trouble.
quotation.source: The Doctor talking about the Master, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: You are incorrigibly meddlesome, Doctor, but we've always felt that your hearts are in the right places.
quotation.source: The unnamed Time Lord, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "I refuse to be worried by a renegade like the Master. He's an unimaginative plodder."
"His degree in cosmic science was of a higher class than yours."
"Yes, well, I was a late developer."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the unnamed Time Lord, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "How much did he pay you?"
"Come, come, Doctor -- gentlemen don't discuss money."
"Nonsense; gentlemen never talk about anything else."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Rossini, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: I think you'll find, Sir, that I'm qualified to deal with practically everything, if I choose.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "Jo, it's a pity escapology wasn't part of your curriculum."
"Funny you should say that. Look." <shows untied hand>
quotation.source: The Doctor and Jo, tied up, in "Terror of the Autons"

quotation.p: "What else can we do?"
"Nothing very much. Oh, I suppose you can take the normal precautions against a nuclear blast, like sticky tape on the windows and that sort of thing."
quotation.source: Chinn and the Master, in "The Claws of Axos"

quotation.p: "What about the Master?"
"I sincerely hope he's with them."
"Hope?"
"I can't be absolutely sure, I was pretty busy at the time. But I'm 90% certain, though."
"How much?"
"Well, pretty certain. <pause> Well, I suppose he could have got away."
quotation.source: Filer and the Doctor, in "The Claws of Axos"

quotation.p: "I don't believe it. It's bigger inside than out!"
"Yes, the TARDIS is dimensionally transcendental."
"What does that mean?"
"It means it's bigger inside than out."
quotation.source: Jo and the Doctor, in "Colony in Space"

quotation.p: "Is the atmosphere poisonous?"
"No, no. It's quite healthy. Similar to Earth, before the invention of the motorcar."
quotation.source: Jo and the Doctor, in "Colony in Space"

quotation.p: Everything that happens in life has a scientific explanation -- if you look for it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: "Would you like to explain that reference, Professor?"
"No."
quotation.source: The BBC man and Professor Horner, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: Why should I believe you? A rationalist existentialist priest, indeed!
quotation.source: Miss Hawthorne, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: "I don't get it."
"Probably because I haven't finished, Captain Yates."
quotation.source: Yates and the Doctor, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: I'm not going to sit here like a spare lemon waiting for the squeezer.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: "Look, we'd get along much faster if we knew what we were doing."
"Yes, I couldn't agree with you more, Sergeant. Now let's concentrate, shall we?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sgt. Osgood, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: "Do you know what you're doing?"
"My dear chap, I can't wait to find out."
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: "How on Earth did you do that?"
"Elemental, my dear Benton."
quotation.source: Benton and the Doctor, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: Jenkins! Chap with the wings there -- five rounds rapid.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "The Daemons"

quotation.p: Look, try and use your intelligence, man, even if you are a politician.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Day of the Daleks"

quotation.p: That's a most good-natured wine. A touch sardonic, perhaps, but not cynical. A most civilized wine, one after my own heart.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Day of the Daleks"

quotation.p: A dream? Really, Doctor, you'll be consulting the entrails of a sheep next.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: You know, Doctor, you're quite the most infuriating man I've ever met.
quotation.source: Jo, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "I feel like the back end of a pantomime horse."
"Very suitable for a keen young man like you."
"Eh? Come again?"
"Starting at the bottom."
quotation.source: Stuart and Dr Ingram, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: Do you know he has an excellent brain, that man... though a little pedestrian. But oh dear, what a bore the fellow is!
quotation.source: The Master, describing the Doctor, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "Empirical?"
"That, Sgt. Benton, means that I haven't got a clue what I'm doing."
quotation.source: Benton and Dr Ingram, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "You're mad... paranoid!"
"Who isn't? The only difference is that I'm just a little more honest than the rest."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Master, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: Oh, those are my subconscious thoughts. I shouldn't listen to them too hard if I were you; I'm not all that proud of some of them.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "E equals m C cubed."
"Squared."
"What?"
"E = m C squared, not cubed."
"Not in the extratemporal physics of the time vortex."
quotation.source: Dr Percival and the Master, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "It doesn't work."
"<dryly> You astound me."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Brigadier, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "The thing is, Doctor, is there anything I can do?"
"Yes, pass me a silicon rod, will you?" <stirs his tea with it>
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "Well, Sergeant? Aren't you going to say that it's bigger on the inside than it is on the outside? Everybody else does."
"It's pretty obvious, isn't it?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sgt. Benton, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "Nothing to do with you surprises me any more."
"Thank you for the compliment."
quotation.source: Sgt. Benton and the Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "So why don't you consult those all-powerful superiors of yours?"
"Oh, right now they're far from superior. That's why they left it up to me and me and me."
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: I can see you've been doing the TARDIS up a bit. I don't like it.
quotation.source: The second Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "What are we going to do now?"
"Keep it confused, feed it with useless information. I wonder if I have a television set handy?"
quotation.source: Sgt. Benton and the second Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "Look, if you can't reverse the energy drain, the fabric of the entire Universe could be torn apart."
"What if it is? It will make an interesting spectacle."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Omega, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: Power is the only freedom that I seek.
quotation.source: Omega, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: "If only I could find my recorder, I could play you a little something to pass the time."
"We should be thankful for small mercies."
quotation.source: The second Doctor and the Brigadier, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: We're talking about one of the most powerful blokes in the cosmos. "Nobble" him?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Three Doctors"

quotation.p: The generators were built by the old Eternity Perpetual company. They were designed to last forever; that's why the company went bankrupt.
quotation.source: Vorg, in "Carnival of Monsters"

quotation.p: The Tribunal is not deliberating, the Tribunal is arguing. Quite nonsensically, if I may say so.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Carnival of Monsters"

quotation.p: One has no wish to be devoured by alien monstrosities, even in the cause of political progress.
quotation.source: One of the Tribunal, in "Carnival of Monsters"

quotation.p: "Put your finger on there a minute, will you?"
"Here?" <electrical sparks fly> "Ouch!"
"Good; that must be the live terminal."
quotation.source: Vorg and Shirna, in "Carnival of Monsters"

quotation.p: But Doctor, it's exactly your cup of tea. The fellow's bright green, apparently, and dead.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "The Green Death"

quotation.p: "Do I have to order you, Doctor?"
"I wouldn't advise it."
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "The Green Death"

quotation.p: "Your paper on DNA synthesis was quite remarkable for your age."
"A promising youngster, huh?"
"No, no; I mean for the age that you live in."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Professor Jones, in "The Green Death"

quotation.p: Brigadier, a straight line may be the shortest distance between two points, but it is by no means the most interesting.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Time Monster"

quotation.p: "Mark you, it was quite a hairy trip. Good old TARDIS was almost done for -- 'time ram'..."
"Oh, don't tell me. The TARDIS was attacked by a randy sheep with a clock for a face?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in The Paradise of Death

quotation.p: "Look, what's the use of employing the finest investigative journalist in the business --"
"Pause for hollow laughter."
quotation.source: Sarah and Clarinda, in The Paradise of Death

quotation.p: "You see, it's been an age-old custom for at least five years that..."
quotation.source: Freeth, in The Paradise of Death

quotation.p: "Do you know -- yesterday I saw a fox in Piccadilly?"
"And nightingales in Berkeley Square?"
quotation.source: Sgt. Yates and Sarah, in "Invasion of the Dinosaurs"

quotation.p: Well, don't just stand there, Sergeant Benton. Go put yourself under arrest.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Invasion of the Dinosaurs"

quotation.p: "I see."
"Do you?"
"No."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "Death to the Daleks"

quotation.p: "It's rather a pity, in a way. Now the universe is down to 699 wonders."
quotation.source: The Doctor, after the destruction of the city, in "Death to the Daleks"

quotation.p: When everything is new, can anything be a surprise?
quotation.source: Cho-je, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: "Tommy, you're normal! You're just like everybody else!"
"I sincerely hope not."
quotation.source: Sarah and Tommy, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: The ceremonial gift merely symbolizes friendship. We have no need for symbols, you and I.
quotation.source: K'anpo, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: "I know who you are now."
"You were always a little slow on the uptake, my boy."
quotation.source: The Doctor and K'anpo, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: I had to face my fear, Sarah. That was more important than just going on living.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: "This is the abbot of-- no, it's Cho-je. I mean, it looks like Cho-je -- but it's really K'anpo Rinpoche ... I think."
"Thank you. That makes everything quite clear."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Brigadier, in "Planet of the Spiders"

quotation.p: Why is a mouse when it spins?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Robot"

quotation.p: You may be a doctor, but I am the Doctor. The definite article, one might say.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Robot"

quotation.p: "Believe me, Doctor, the place is impregnable."
"Never cared much for the word 'impregnable'. Sound a bit too much like 'unsinkable'."
"What's wrong with 'unsinkable'?"
"Nothing, as the iceberg said to the Titanic."
quotation.source: The Brigadier, the Doctor, and Harry in "Robot"

quotation.p: "Well naturally enough the only country that could be trusted with such a role was Great Britain."
"Well, naturally. I mean, the rest were all foreigners."
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "Robot"

quotation.p: The trouble with computers, of course, is that they're very sophisticated idiots.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Robot"

quotation.p: You know, just once I'd like to meet an alien menace that wasn't immune to bullets.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Robot"

quotation.p: There's no point in being grown-up if you can't be childish sometimes.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Robot"

quotation.p: "For interrogation? Good, I enjoy interrogations."
"Yes, you look the type."
quotation.source: General Raven and the Doctor, in "Genesis of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "And Davros is never wrong about anything."
"Then he must be exceptional; even I'm occasionally wrong about some things."
quotation.source: Ronson and the Doctor, in "Genesis of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Just touch these two strands together, and the Daleks are finished. Have I that right?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Genesis of the Daleks"

quotation.p: But the final responsibility is mine, and mine alone. Listen; if someone who knew the future pointed out a child to you, and told you that that child would grow up totally evil, to be a ruthless dictator who would destroy millions of lives, could you then kill that child?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Genesis of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Failed? No, not really. You see, I know that although the Daleks will create havoc and destruction for millions of years, I know also that out of their evil must come something good.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Genesis of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Oil, an emergency? About time the people who run this planet of yours realize that to be dependent upon a mineral slime just doesn't make sense. Now, the energizing of hydrogen---
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: "As far as we know, the sea was calm and empty."
"It may be calm, but it's never empty."
quotation.source: Huckle and the Doctor, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: "Doctor, are you a party to this militaristic nonsense?"
"I'm not a party to any kind of nonsense, your Grace."
quotation.source: The Duke of Forgill and the Doctor, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: I underestimated his intelligence, but he underestimated the power of organic crystallography.
quotation.source: Broton, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: It takes all sorts to make a galaxy.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: The Cabinet's accepted my report, and the whole affair is now completely closed. ... A fifty-foot monster can't swim up the Thames and attack a large building without some people noticing, but you know what politicians are like.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Terror of the Zygons"

quotation.p: You and I are scientists, Professor. We buy our privilege to experiment at the cost of total responsibility.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Planet of Evil"

quotation.p: "Victoria wore [that dress]. She travelled with me for a time."
"Well, as long as Albert didn't wear it."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: I'm a Time Lord... I'm not a human being. I walk in eternity.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "We travel in time, Mr Scarman. I'm really from 1980."
"That is utterly preposterous, Miss Smith."
"Yes. Sorry."
quotation.source: Sarah and Laurence Scarman, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "Are you telling me you don't know what year it is?"
"If I knew, I wouldn't ask. Don't be obtuse, man!"
quotation.source: Laurence Scarman and the Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: Well, you see, Mr Scarman, I have the advantage of being slightly ahead of you. Sometimes behind you, but normally ahead of you.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "I see."
"I'm sure you don't, but it's very nice of you to try."
quotation.source: Laurence Scarman and the Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "Where are we?"
"Hiding."
"Where?"
"A priest's hole."
"In a Victorian Gothic folly? Nonsense."
"You're so pedantic at a time like this? What does it matter?"
quotation.source: The Doctor, Sarah, and Laurence Scarman, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: That's the world as Sutekh would leave it: a desolate planet circling a dead sun.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: Deactivating a generator loop without the correct key, it's like repairing a watch with a hammer and chisel. One false move and you'll never know the time again.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: Evil? Your evil is my good. I am Sutekh the destroyer. Where I tread I leave nothing but dust and darkness. I find that good.
quotation.source: Sutekh, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "That's too obvious."
"Well, a door handle usually is."
"Not in a jail."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: "But I thought Horus was one of the good guys."
"He was an Osiran, with all their guile and ingenuity. They had dome- shaped heads and cerebrums like spiral staircases."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Pyramids of Mars"

quotation.p: My memory is getting poor. 300 years ago I would have recognized this like a shot.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: "What's this pub called?"
"The Fleur de Lis, isn't it?"
"Marie Celeste, more like."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: Is that finger loaded?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: "So far, so good"
"Said the man when he fell from the skyscraper."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: The best-laid plans of mice and Kraals gang aft a-gley.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: "I feel disoriented."
"This is the Disorientation Centre."
"That makes sense."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: "Must have blacked out."
"Yes, you did. The G-force cut the blood supply to what you humans laughingly call your higher centres."
"I hate sarcasm, especially when I'm dying."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: "So, providing we don't burn up on re-entry and aren't suffocated on the way down, we'll probably be smashed to a pulp when we land."
"Exactly. Sarah, you've put your finger on the one tiny flaw in our plan."
"Our plan? It's your plan!"
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Android Invasion"

quotation.p: You mean you still practice teleportation? How quaint! Now, if you got yourself a decent forklift truck...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Brain of Morbius"

quotation.p: Death is the price we pay for progress, you know.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Brain of Morbius"

quotation.p: I know the Time Lords -- pallid, tedious worms!
quotation.source: Morbius, in "The Brain of Morbius"

quotation.p: "And what is your bureau doing about bonsai?"
"Bonsai, Mr Chase?"
"Mutilation and torture, Mr Dunbar. The hideous, grotesque Japanese practice of miniaturizing shrubs and trees. What is your bureau doing about that?"
quotation.source: Harrison Chase and Dunbar, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: You are concerned about the fate of the blue whale and the natterjack toad, yet the obvious, most defenceless part of creation, the kingdom of plant life, receives no protection at all.
quotation.source: Harrison Chase, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "You must be the Doctor. We were expecting someone much older."
"I'm only 749. Used to be even younger."
quotation.source: Moberly and the Doctor, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "Are you OK, dressed like that? You don't seem to notice the cold."
"I haven't come ten thousand miles to discuss the weather, Mr Moberly."
quotation.source: Moberly and the Doctor, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: It's more serious than death, Mr Stevenson. He's changing form.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "They travel in pairs, like policemen."
"Well, what are we going to do with it? Buy it a truncheon?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "You're going well outside the law, Mr Chase."
"I understand policemen are few and far between in the Antarctic."
quotation.source: Dunbar and Chase, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: You know, Doctor, I could play all day in my green cathedral.
quotation.source: Harrison Chase, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "You're working for a madman, Scorby; you know that?"
"He pays well. And when it comes to money, Mr Chase and I are of the same religion."
"Franklin Adams, 1881-1960. American humorist."
"The quotes are over, Doctor!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Scorby, in "The Seeds of Doom"

quotation.p: "Boot cupboard? But it's enormous!"
"Oh, I've seen bigger boot cupboards."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "There are no measurements in infinity. You humans have got such limited little minds; I don't know why I like you so much."
"Because you have such good taste."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "There's this man in Florence claims that by arranging ground glasses in a certain order, it's possible to see the moon and stars as large as your hand."
"Is that a good thing?"
quotation.source: Duke Juliano and Marco, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "Exactly as it was foretold -- a maiden fair of face and sturdy of body."
"You can forget the flattery; what do you lot want?"
quotation.source: The high priest and Sarah, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: I warn you, Rossini -- fail me, and you will breakfast on burning coals.
quotation.source: Count Federico, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "Oh, stop being so silly."
"Remember the French at Agincourt."
"But they lost!"
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: You know, the worse the situation the worse your jokes get.
quotation.source: Sarah, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: A Time Lord has to do what a Time Lord has to do.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "Is it dangerous?"
"Well, only if I guessed wrong, and then it's fatal."
quotation.source: Sarah and the Doctor, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: "Therefore, if I've guessed correctly about the nature of helix energy, I should be able to drain it off."
"But what if you've guessed wrong?"
"When did I ever guess wrong about anything?"
"Lots of times."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sarah, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: Had a hard day in the catacombs, have we?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Masque of Mandragora"

quotation.p: Vaporisation without representation is against the constitution!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: Chancellor, all presidents are faced with difficult decisions. It is by their decisions that they are judged.
quotation.source: Cardinal Borusa, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: If heroes don't exist, it is necessary to invent them; good for public morale.
quotation.source: Cardinal Borusa, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: Later, Castellan, we must take another look at data security.
quotation.source: Cardinal Borusa, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: "Only in mathematics will we find truth." ... Borusa used to say that during my time at the Academy, and now he's setting out to prove it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: As I believe I told you long ago, Doctor, you will never amount to anything in the galaxy while you retain your propensity for vulgar facetiousness.
quotation.source: Cardinal Borusa, in "The Deadly Assassin"

quotation.p: Beware the devious Calib. One day he'll get so cunning even he won't know what he's planning.
quotation.source: Leela, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: "The Evil One!"
"Well, nobody's perfect, but that's overstating it a little."
quotation.source: Leela and the Doctor, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: "Would you like a jelly baby?"
"It is true, then; the Evil One eats babies!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Leela, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: "I don't know what to believe any more."
"Well, that sounds healthy, anyway. Never be certain of anything; it's a sign of weakness."
quotation.source: Leela and the Doctor, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: I'm the Doctor. Who are you and why are you shooting at me?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: You can't expect perfection, not even from me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: "You know, I had a feeling that Niever was actually expecting to hear an answer to his prayer."
"There wouldn't be much point in praying if you didn't."
"I could quote you a few theologians who'd give you an argument on that."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Leela, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: You know the very powerful and the very stupid have one thing in common. They don't alter their views to fit the facts, they alter the facts to fit their views, which can be uncomfortable if you happen to be one of the facts that needs altering.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Face of Evil"

quotation.p: "Do you know what that is?"
"It is a laserson probe. It can puncture fist-sized holes in six-inch armor plate, or take the crystals from a snowflake, one by one."
"Yes, that's right. No handyman should be without one."
quotation.source: The Doctor and D.84, in "The Robots of Death"

quotation.p: Please do not throw hands at me.
quotation.source: D.84, in "The Robots of Death"

quotation.p: "Robots can't harm humans; it's the first principle."
"The second principle is that humans can't harm robots. I know, I've tried and they don't bleed."
quotation.source: Toos and Leela, in "The Robots of Death"

quotation.p: "I see, you're one of those boring maniacs who's going to gloat, hm? You going to tell me your plan for running the universe?"
"Oh no, Doctor. I'm going to burn out your brain, very slowly."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Dask, in "The Robots of Death"

quotation.p: "Doctor, why didn't the helium make your voice go squeaky?"
"Because I'm a Time Lord. I've been around, you know."
quotation.source: Leela and the Doctor, in "The Robots of Death"

quotation.p: "This is a big village."
"Yes."
"What's the name of the tribe here?"
"Cockneys."
quotation.source: Leela and the Doctor in London, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: "Good evening, sir. Do you know this young female, sir?"
"Oh, yes, yes. We were attacked by this little man and four other little men."
"When I got here, sir, he was being strangled with his own pigtail."
"Really? Girlish enthusiasm, officer?"
quotation.source: A police officer and the Doctor, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: "Flickering shadows, Casey. Trick of the light."
"Shadows don't groan, Mr Jago. Shadows don't clank chains and moan like all the demented souls in hell."
quotation.source: Jago and Casey, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: "Forgive us, ma'am."
"For what?"
"For being so indelicate in the presence of a lady of refinement."
"Does he mean me?"
quotation.source: Litefoot and Leela, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: Sleep is for tortoises.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: Elementary, my dear Litefoot.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: Soon I shall join my ancestors. Already I can see them. They walk to greet me from the palace of jade. They are smiling, and carry gifts of fruit and flowers. Now I cross the golden bridge of the gods.
quotation.source: Li H'sen Chang's last words, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: "Eureka" is Greek for "This bath is too hot".
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: "And then, for example, I would say, 'One lump or two, Miss Leela?' To which you reply 'One will suffice, thank you.' Now do you follow?"
"Supposing I want two?"
"Oh no no no; one lump for ladies."
"Then why do you ask me?"
quotation.source: Litefoot and Leela, in "The Talons of Weng-Chiang"

quotation.p: Enjoy your death as I enjoyed killing you.
quotation.source: Leela to the Rutan, in "Horror of Fang Rock"

quotation.p: "Aye, though we hunted high and low, and hunted everywhere, of the three men's fate we found no trace, in any time, in any place, but a door ajar, and an untouched meal, and an over-tottled chair."
quotation.source: The Doctor quotes Wilfred Gibson, in "Horror of Fang Rock"

quotation.p: That's the trouble with computers, always think in black and white. No aquamarines, no blues, no imagination.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invisible Enemy"

quotation.p: Sometimes, my brilliance astonishes even me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invisible Enemy"

quotation.p: "That's your answer to everything -- knock it on the head."
"Effective, isn't it? Smash it once and for all?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Leela, in "The Invisible Enemy"

quotation.p: "Shall we try using our intelligence?"
"Well, if you think that's a good idea."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Leela, in "The Invisible Enemy"

quotation.p: Your ancestors have a talent for self-destruction that borders on genius.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "There's a corpse by the wood."
"What sort of corpse?"
"A dead one; what other sort is there?"
quotation.source: Colby and Fendelman, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "By the look of him, he didn't die easily."
"It is never easy to die."
quotation.source: Colby and Max, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: Good morning, ladies. Now which one of you has the time scanner?
quotation.source: The Doctor, to a group of cows, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "You've both escaped from somewhere, haven't you?"
"Frequently."
quotation.source: The verger and the Doctor, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "How do 'e know so much?"
"I read a lot."
quotation.source: Mrs Tyler and the Doctor, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: The fifth planet is 107 million miles out and 12 million years back, so we've no time to lose.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: It's a good thing your tribe never developed guns; they'd have woken with a start one morning and wiped themselves out.
quotation.source: The Doctor, to Leela, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: The Time Lords are a very meticulous people; you have to be when you live as long as we do.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "That would explain the dark side of man's nature, but it's just a theory."
"A pretty wild one."
"It's more fun that way."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Colby, in "Image of the Fendahl"

quotation.p: "There was even a picture of a tree, a fine thing."
"Simply a primitive way of producing oxygen. Thank the Company, we have no need of trees on Pluto."
quotation.source: Citizen Cordo and the Gatherer, in "The Sunmakers"

quotation.p: He can't make ends meet -- probably too many economists in the government.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Sunmakers"

quotation.p: "These 'taxes', they are like sacrifices to tribal gods?"
"Well, roughly speaking, but paying taxes is more painful."
quotation.source: Leela and the Doctor, in "The Sunmakers"

quotation.p: This is the moment when I get a real sense of job satisfaction.
quotation.source: The Collector, at Leela's execution, in "The Sunmakers"

quotation.p: Grinding oppression of the masses is the only policy that pays dividends.
quotation.source: The Collector, in "The Sunmakers"

quotation.p: "Have you ever heard of the Flying Dutchman?"
"No."
"Pity; I've often wanted to know who he was."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Leela, in "Underworld"

quotation.p: Prognostication impossible in matters concerning the Doctor.
quotation.source: K9, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: It's always a matter of time, eh Castellan? Especially for Time Lords...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: Cerebral circuits in order. Physiognomy dubious.
quotation.source: K9 assesses the Doctor's condition, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: "What form of treachery are you planning now?"
"A rather more effective form than your own, I hope."
quotation.source: Andred and the Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: <looks at his palm> "I know this TARDIS like the back of my hand." <Leela turns the Doctor's hand over>
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: Why don't you stabilize your pedestrian infrastructure, President?
quotation.source: Borusa, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: There is no point in further discussion. Discussion is for the wise and the helpless, and I am neither.
quotation.source: Leela, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: Maybe I am getting too young for this sort of thing.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: One grows tired of jelly babies, Castellan. One grows tired of almost everything, Castellan, except power.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: "But you have access to the greatest source of knowledge in the universe."
"Well, I do talk to myself sometimes, yes."
"I mean the Matrix."
quotation.source: Andred and the Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: "Where will he go now?"
"Somewhere else."
quotation.source: Borusa and Leela bid farewell to the Doctor, in "The Invasion of Time"

quotation.p: "You mean nothing will happen to me?"
"Nothing at all. Ever."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the White Guardian, in "The Ribos Operation"

quotation.p: "My name is Romanadvoratrelundar."
"I'm so sorry about that. Is there anything we can do?"
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "The Ribos Operation"

quotation.p: It's funny, but you know, before I met you, I was actually willing to be impressed.
quotation.source: Romana to the Doctor, in "The Ribos Operation"

quotation.p: "But he had such an honest face."
"Romana, you can't be a successful criminal with a dishonest face."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "The Ribos Operation"

quotation.p: "You don't think that's wrong, do you?"
"Wrong? It's an economic miracle. Of course it's wrong."
quotation.source: Kimus and the Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: I'll never be cruel to an electron in a particle accelerator again.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: He's the one you should be talking to, or rather listening to, if you have the stamina.
quotation.source: Romana describes the Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: Doctor, beware; your manner appeals only to the homicidal side of my nature.
quotation.source: The Captain, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: "I just put 1.795372 and 2.204628 together."
"And what does that mean?"
"Four!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: What do you want? You don't want to take over the universe, do you? No... you wouldn't know what to do with it, beyond shout at it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: The concept is simply staggering. Pointless, but staggering.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: My biorhythms must be at an all-time low.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: "A plank?"
"The theory is very simple. You walk along it, at the end you fall off. Drop one thousand feet. Dead."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Captain, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: "All guards, alert: someone is using a counterjamming frequency projector. Find it and destroy it immediately."
"I don't suppose any of the guards know what a counterjamming frequency projector looks like."
"Destroy everything!"
quotation.source: The Captain and Mr Fibuli, in "The Pirate Planet"

quotation.p: "I warn you, Doctor; he doesn't like scientists."
"Well, very few people do, in my experience."
quotation.source: Professor Rumford and the Doctor, in "The Stones of Blood"

quotation.p: "I still don't understand about hyperspace."
"Well, who does?"
"I do!"
"Oh, shut up, K9!"
quotation.source: Professor Rumford, the Doctor, and K9 in "The Stones of Blood"

quotation.p: Gosh, that takes me back. Or forward. That's the trouble with time travel; you can never remember.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Androids of Tara"

quotation.p: "What's that? Is it yours?"
"My favorite charger. Strong as a tree and swift as the wind."
"Well, how does it go? What makes it work?"
"Good heavens, I don't know, my dear."
"You don't?"
"I'm a knight, not a farrier."
quotation.source: Romana and Count Grendel, in "The Androids of Tara"

quotation.p: Would you mind not standing on my chest? My hat's on fire.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Androids of Tara"

quotation.p: "A swordsman does not fear death if he dies with honour."
"Then he's an idiot."
quotation.source: Farrah and the Doctor, in "The Androids of Tara"

quotation.p: "Would you let a small band of semi-savages stand in the way of progress?"
"Well, progress is a very flexible word. It can mean just about anything you want it to mean."
quotation.source: Fenner and the Doctor, in "The Power of Kroll"

quotation.p: "Oh, it's a sort of Holy Writ?"
"It's atrociously writ."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "The Power of Kroll"

quotation.p: "Why do you always assume the worst?"
"Because it usually happens."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: "Where's your joy in life? Where's your optimism?"
"It opted out."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: "Optimism: belief that everything will work out well. Irrational, bordering on insane."
"Oh, do shut up, K9."
quotation.source: K9 and the Doctor, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: I'll explain it to you another time, when I've got about two weeks to spare.
quotation.source: Romana, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: Your silliness is noted. Drive systems regenerating...
quotation.source: K9, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: It is not power that we seek, but destruction that we glory in.
quotation.source: The Shadow, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: Did you ever get to Troy, Drax? A little place in Asia Minor...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: Is that all you can say? She was a living being, and now what is she? A component!
quotation.source: Romana, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: "Remember me to Gallifrey."
"Bye-bye, Drax..."
quotation.source: Drax and the Doctor, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: We have the power to do anything we like. Absolute power over every particle in the universe. Everything that has ever existed or ever will exist, as from this moment. Are you listening to me, Romana? Because if you're not listening, I can make you listen. Because I can do anything. As from this moment there is no such thing as free will in the entire universe -- there is only my will, because I possess the Key to Time.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: "Hence, this new device. It's called a randomizer, and it's fitted to the guidance systems and operates under a very complex scientific principle called pot luck. No one knows where we're going, not even the Black Guardian."
"Not even us."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Armageddon Factor"

quotation.p: How can a robot catch laryngitis? I mean, what do you need it for?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Ooh, look; rocks!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Who was it said the living are just the dead on holiday?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Judging by design and size, I'd say it had intergalactic range and time-rip capability."
"Well, without reference to my Jane's Spacecraft of the Universe I wouldn't dispute that."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "They taught me at school how to stop my hearts."
"Hearts? How many have you got?"
"One for casual, one for best."
quotation.source: Romana and Tyson, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "I have failed!"
"What's it like?"
quotation.source: Davros and the Doctor, in "Destiny of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "There we are: the Louvre. One of the greatest art galleries in the whole galaxy."
"Nonsense; what about the Academia Stellaris on Sirius V?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: One of my funny turns? The whole world took a funny turn...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: "Einstein says that--"
"I'm not paying Einstein, Professor; I'm paying you."
quotation.source: Professor Kerensky and Scaroth, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: I say, what a wonderful butler; he's so violent!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: Doctor, the more you try to convince me that you're a fool, the more I'm likely to think otherwise.
quotation.source: The Countess, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: "My dear, I don't think he's as stupid as he seems."
"My dear, nobody could be as stupid as he seems."
quotation.source: The Countess and Count discuss the Doctor, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: "You know what I don't understand?"
"I expect so."
quotation.source: Duggan and Romana, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: "If you do that one more time, Duggan, I'm going to take very, very severe measures."
"Yeah, like what?"
"Er... I'm going to ask you not to."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Duggan, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: Duggan, why is it that every time I start to talk to someone, you knock him unconscious?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: I suppose the best way to find out where you come from is to find out where you're going, and then work backwards.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "City of Death"

quotation.p: Well, to be fair I did have a couple of gadgets he probably didn't, like a teaspoon and an open mind.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Creature From the Pit"

quotation.p: Stupid expression, "stands to reason". Why isn't it "lie down to reason"? -- much easier to reason lying down...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Creature From the Pit"

quotation.p: I suppose you could say "the yoke's on him", if you were the sort of person who said that sort of thing, which fortunately I'm not.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Creature From the Pit"

quotation.p: "Oh, you shouldn't be worried; Time Lords have 90 lives."
"How many have you got through?
"About 130."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Creature From the Pit"

quotation.p: She's tipped the ambassador into a pit and threw astrologers at him.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Creature From the Pit"

quotation.p: "I don't think we should interfere."
"Interfere? Of course we should interfere! Always do what you're best at, that's what I say."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "I like doing the impossible."
"If it's possible to get in to the situation, theoretically it should be possible to get out of it."
"Oh, you've spoilt it now."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "Me? Well, I told you, I'm from Galactic."
"Galactic went out of business twenty years ago."
"I wondered why I hadn't been paid."
"That's not good enough."
"That's what I thought."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Rigg, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: [Professor Stein] was my mentor. We worked on this idea together, before he died, of course. Then we stopped.
quotation.source: Tryst, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "First a collision, then a dead navigator, and now a monster running about my ship. It's totally inexplicable."
"Nothing's inexplicable."
"Then explain it."
"... Inexplicable."
quotation.source: Rigg and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "Yes, but who do you work for?"
"Work for? I don't work for anybody; I'm just having fun."
quotation.source: Rigg and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "Your name and date of birth?"
"I'm called the Doctor; date of birth... difficult to remember, sometime quite soon I think."
quotation.source: Fisk and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "I've never met such idiots as those Customs men."
"Idiots? They're worse than idiots, they're bureaucrats..."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "What is it?"
"It's a perfectly ordinary electric dog."
quotation.source: Stott and the Doctor meet K9, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "I shall be charging you with gross neglect of duty. The passengers should be your first concern, yet I find you drunkenly looking on as they are attacked and killed. Well?"
"They're only economy class; what's all the fuss about?"
quotation.source: Fisk and Rigg, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: Oh, my fingers! My arms! My legs! My everything! Argh...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "Romana, you've got two minutes, 58 seconds to rebuild this machine."
"What, this? The CET? Are you joking?"
"Do I look as if I'm joking? Well?"
"I'll need a screwdriver."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "Nightmare of Eden"

quotation.p: "I wonder what it would be like to be crushed into a singularity?"
"Don't stand there wondering; do something!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: Have you noticed how people's intellectual curiosity declines sharply the moment they start waving guns about?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: "Brilliant! I wish I'd thought of that!"
"Oh, you will, Doctor, you will."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: You know, K9, sometimes I think I'm wasted, just rushing around the universe saving planets from destruction. With a talent like mine, I might have been a great slow bowler.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: "Sounds like an insecure personality to me."
"He lives in the power complex."
"That fits."
quotation.source: Romana and Seth, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: "The great civil war... only the army survived."
"Well, that sounds like a well-organized war."
quotation.source: Seth and Romana, in "The Horns of Nimon"

quotation.p: "Isn't it wonderful how something so primitive can be so--"
"Graceful?"
"No, simple. You just push in one direction, the boat goes in the other."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "I do love the spring. All the leaves, the colours."
"It's October."
"I thought you said we were coming here for May Week."
"I did. May Week's in June."
"I'm confused."
"So was the TARDIS."
<pause> "Oh, I do love the autumn. All the leaves, the colours."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Shada"

quotation.p: Well, at least in something as simple as a punt nothing can go wrong -- no coordinates, no dimensional stabilizers, nothing. Just the water, a punt, a strong pair of hands, and the pole. <then loses the pole>
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Shada"

quotation.p: For every reaction, there's an opposite and equally different action.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "I told you you'd got the time wrong, Doctor."
"Yes, but you're always saying that."
"You're always getting the time wrong."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "Was it to do with the voices?"
"What voices?"
"When I was on the river, I heard a strange babble of inhuman voices."
"Oh, undergraduates talking to each other, I expect. I've tried to have it banned."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Professor Chronotis, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "Oh, yes, Salyavin. He was a boyhood hero of mine."
"Really, Doctor? A great criminal your hero?"
"Yeah, well, a criminal, yes, but he had such style, such flair, such..."
"Panache?"
"Yes, he was a bit like me in that respect."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "Skagra, what have you done with the professor's mind?"
"It is to be put to a more useful purpose."
"It was serving a perfectly useful purpose where it was."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Skagra, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "You take a very proprietorial attitude to other people's brains."
"It seems to me that the Time Lords take a very proprietorial view of the universe."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Skagra, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "Skagra, do you realize this book doesn't make one bit of sense?"
"A fool would realize it was written in code."
"Skagra?"
"What?"
"This thing is written in code. How am I doing?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Skagra, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "I was meant to be delivering a paper to the Astronomical Society tonight."
"Oh, yes?"
"Yes, I finally disproved the, uh, possibility of life on other planets."
"Oh yes."
"Well, I can deliver it next month's. Have to be a complete rewrite though."
quotation.source: Chris and Romana, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "Look. What do you see?"
"Nothing."
"Billions of atoms, spinning at random, expending energy, running down, achieving nothing.
"Entropy, like the stars. But what is the one thing that stands against entropy, against random decay? Life. See how the atoms are arranged here? They have meaning, purpose."
quotation.source: Skagra and Romana, in "Shada"

quotation.p: I know it's very difficult to understand. It's also very easy to be sarcastic.
quotation.source: Wilkin, in "Shada"

quotation.p: "You've got the century wrong, you've got the season wrong, and you've got K9's seawater defences wrong!"
"Well, I can't get everything right."
"Just something would be a help."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "The Leisure Hive"

quotation.p: One must always accept the unexpected.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Leisure Hive"

quotation.p: "His scarf killed Stimson!"
"Arrest the scarf, then."
quotation.source: The authorities and the Doctor, in "The Leisure Hive"

quotation.p: Evidence? You couldn't hang a hat on that.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Leisure Hive"

quotation.p: Some galactic hobo with ideas above his station... the cosmos is full of them.
quotation.source: The Doctor describes the Black Guardian, in "The Leisure Hive"

quotation.p: First things first, but not necessarily in that order.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Meglos"

quotation.p: "A little patience goes a long way."
"Yes. Too much patience goes absolutely nowhere."
quotation.source: Login and the Doctor, in "Full Circle"

quotation.p: "The marsh creatures are mindless brutes... animals!"
"Yes, easy enough to destroy. Have you ever tried creating one?"
quotation.source: The Decider and the Doctor, in "Full Circle"

quotation.p: We're all basically primeval slime with ideas above its station.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Full Circle"

quotation.p: The green button, gentlemen!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Full Circle"

quotation.p: "They asked me to stay on, you know -- be a Decider."
"You, a Decider?"
"Yes. I decided not to."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "Full Circle"

quotation.p: Knowing's easy; everyone does that ad nauseam. I just sort of hope.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "State of Decay"

quotation.p: "Funny about the windows?"
"What windows?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Romana, in "State of Decay"

quotation.p: "No, I'd say a sociopathetic abscess."
"Oh, I wish I'd said that."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "State of Decay"

quotation.p: You can compile a reverse transition from existing data -- you love doing that.
quotation.source: The Doctor, to K9, in "State of Decay"

quotation.p: "Well, Doctor?"
"Yes, I'm fine."
quotation.source: Romana and the Doctor, in "State of Decay"

quotation.p: Probability computed at 0.00057, Mistress. There is a .567 error correction to that estimate. Error in error-correction estimate estimated at 0.375.
quotation.source: K9, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: He's mad. The backblast backlash'll bounce back and destroy everything!
quotation.source: Romana, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: You were the noblest Romana of them all.
quotation.source: The Doctor echoes Shakespeare's Julius Caesar, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: Nothing ... well, that's something.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: One solid hope's worth a cartload of certainties.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: "Will Romana be all right?"
"All right? She'll be superb."
quotation.source: Adric and the Doctor, in "Warrior's Gate"

quotation.p: "Adric, I give you a privileged insight into the mystery of time, yes?"
"Open your mind to adventures beyond imagining, yes?"
"And you criticize my logic!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Adric, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: "No, I'm just saying that a lot of the time you don't really make sense."
"Ah. Oh, you've noticed that, have you?"
quotation.source: Adric and the Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: "Traken Union, famous for its harmony. A whole empire held together by... by people being terribly nice to each other."
"Well, that makes a change."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Adric, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: If I knew everything that was about to happen, where would the fun be?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: Time reveals everything.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: "As you can see, the passing ages have taken toll of me."
"Yes. Yes, I know that feeling."
quotation.source: The Keeper and the Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: They say the atmosphere there was so full of goodness that evil just shrivelled up and died. Maybe that's why I never went there.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: They did say I have a terribly sophisticated prose style.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: Magnificent. It's a pity about that poor chap having to sit for thousands of years in a chair, but it is magnificent.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: "Still, what can't be cured must be endured."
"That's the silliest thing you've said yet."
"Then don't listen to me. I never do."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Adric, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: I used to know an ancient remedy for mad dogs. I must look it up sometime. Good library here, have you?
quotation.source: The Doctor in the Master's TARDIS, in "The Keeper of Traken"

quotation.p: Still, the future lies this way.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "Intone the computations? Why?"
"I've wondered that myself. Never had the nerve to ask them."
quotation.source: Adric and the Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "Are you sure?"
"This is life; nothing's sure."
quotation.source: Adric and the Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: He's a Time Lord! In many ways we have the same mind.
quotation.source: The Doctor, on the Master, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: Fold back the omega configuration.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: Never guess, unless you have to; there's enough uncertainty in the universe as it is.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "Perhaps you would like to see more of Logopolis."
"I'd prefer to see a lot less of it."
quotation.source: The Monitor and Tegan, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "How do we get him out of there?"
"Thought and computation."
quotation.source: Tegan and the Monitor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: Our manipulation of numbers directly changes the physical world. There is no other mathematics like ours.
quotation.source: The Monitor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: The cheeseboard is the world, and the pieces the phenomena of the universe, as my old friend Huxley used to say. <pause> Cheeseboard?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: Logopolis is a cold place, a cold high place overlooking the universe.
quotation.source: The Master, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "If we do cooperate, there'll be no question of your ever returning to Gallifrey."
"If we don't cooperate, there'll be no question of Gallifrey."
quotation.source: The Master and the Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "I envy you your TARDIS, Master."
"Excellent, Doctor; envy is the beginning of all true greatness."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Master, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "Woolly thinking, Doctor."
"Yes, very comforting when worn next to the skin."
quotation.source: The Master and the Doctor, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: "The Doctor calls it a reiterated invitation to deep-space alien intelligences."
"And that's us!"
quotation.source: Adric and Nyssa, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: It is the end... but the moment has been prepared for.
quotation.source: The Doctor's final words, in "Logopolis"

quotation.p: I wonder, boy, what would you do if you were me, hm? Or perhaps I should ask, what would I do if I were me?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: How do we find the index file? Of course, if we had an index file, we could look it up in the index file under "index file".
quotation.source: Tegan, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: That's the trouble with regeneration. You never quite know what you're going to get.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: <reading label> "The solution." Oh, my little friend, if only you were...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: "He says he doesn't know who he is or why he has come."
"Well, I admire a man with an open mind."
quotation.source: Ruther and Shardovan, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: "One... two..."
"Three, sir."
"What?"
"Three, sir, it's what comes after two."
"Do you know, that's exactly what I thought?"
"And then four, and then five, and then six, and then seven---"
"Stop, please! You're making me dizzy!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and a young girl, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: Which is the quickest way out of here? <the women all point in different directions> Yes, well, that's democracy for you.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: You know, I'm very fond of history, but I don't get much time for reading.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: It's on the tip of my mind.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: Say something, please! "Yes" would be best.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: You made us, man of evil, but we are free!
quotation.source: Shardovan, to the Master, in "Castrovalva"

quotation.p: Oh, he's always in trouble, Tegan, hadn't you noticed? It amuses him...
quotation.source: Adric, about the Doctor, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "A doctor? Of what?"
"Everything."
"How modest."
quotation.source: Enlightenment, the Doctor and Persuasion, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "You're very kind."
"I am merely civilized."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Monarch, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "How barbaric!"
"Yes, a lot of it about."
quotation.source: Enlightenment and the Doctor, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "You possess an energy you do not understand?"
"Yes, silly, isn't it? Only my professor at the Academy seemed to understand it.
quotation.source: Monarch and the Doctor, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "You grasp the theory of relativity?"
"Doesn't everyone?"
quotation.source: Monarch and Adric, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: Could anyone pass the sodium chloride, please?
quotation.source: Adric, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: Such a being prefers mental anarchy. They call it freedom.
quotation.source: Enlightenment, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: "Love?"
"The exchange of two fantasies, your Majesty."
quotation.source: Monarch and Enlightenment, in "Four to Doomsday"

quotation.p: An apple a day keeps the... ah, no, never mind.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Kinda"

quotation.p: I never think twice about anything; takes too much time.
quotation.source: Sanders, in "Kinda"

quotation.p: "What do we say if the door is opened?"
"'Hello'?"
quotation.source: Richard Mace and Adric, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: Why are Earth people so parochial?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: "You're being a very stupid woman."
"That isn't a very original observation."
quotation.source: A Terileptil and Tegan, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: Call yourself a Time Lord! A broken clock keeps better time than you do; at least it's accurate twice a day, which is more than you ever are!
quotation.source: Tegan, to the Doctor, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: "How do you feel now?"
"Groggy, sore, and bad-tempered."
"Oh. Almost your old self."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Tegan, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: I said "empathise", not "be silly".
quotation.source: Nyssa, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: "Why didn't you say that's what you were looking for?"
"Because I wasn't looking for it until I found it."
quotation.source: Tegan and the Doctor, in "The Visitation"

quotation.p: E-space is another universe; there isn't a taxi service goes back and forth.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: I'm going outside now; I might be gone some time.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: I'm just a mouth on legs.
quotation.source: Tegan, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: "I think Mr Ringway is recovering."
"Pity. I've just composed a particularly nasty epitaph for him."
quotation.source: Adric and Briggs, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: "That could take forever."
"Then I suggest we start at once."
quotation.source: Berger and Adric, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: Now I'll never know if I was right.
quotation.source: Adric's last words, in "Earthshock"

quotation.p: You know how it is; you put things off for a day and before you know it it's a hundred years later.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Arc of Infinity"

quotation.p: "I have my orders."
"You don't have to relish them so much."
quotation.source: Maxil and the Doctor, in "Arc of Infinity"

quotation.p: Our duty, if not our conscience, is clear.
quotation.source: President Borusa, in "Arc of Infinity"

quotation.p: "What would you say if I told you I was looking for my TARDIS?"
"Very little."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the amnesiac Brigadier, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: I hate transmats. Like travelling in a food mixer and just as dangerous.
quotation.source: Tegan, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: After all, if I was suffering from amnesia I'd be the first to know about it, shouldn't I?
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: I've lost my TARDIS, you've lost your memory; I'd be surprised if the two events weren't related.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: Oh, I know how many beans make five, Doctor. You don't have to be a Time Lord to cope with A-level maths.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: "What's past is --"
"-- is very much in the present. Brigadier, you never did understand the interrelation of time."
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "Mawdryn Undead"

quotation.p: A burden shared is a ... something or other.
quotation.source: Bor, in "Terminus"

quotation.p: It's controlled by the computer, and the computer's uncontrollable.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Terminus"

quotation.p: You represent a poor investment of my time and energy.
quotation.source: The Black Guardian, to Turlough, in "Terminus"

quotation.p: "It'll be good to see the TARDIS again."
"And Tegan!"
"Yes, well..."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Tegan, in "Terminus"

quotation.p: "I don't understand it."
"He never does."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Turlough, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "What if the White Guardian tells me something important?"
"Thank him politely."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Tegan, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: You are a Time Lord, a lord of time. Are there lords in such a small domain?
quotation.source: Captain Striker, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "Enlightenment?"
"The wisdom which knows all things and which will enable me to achieve what I desire most. Do not ask what it is; I will not tell you."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Captain Striker, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "Your companion is a very beautiful woman."
"Is she?"
"The confusion in her mind is exhilarating."
quotation.source: Marriner and the Doctor, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "Are you trying to tell me you're in love?"
"Love? What is 'love'? I want existence."
quotation.source: Tegan and Marriner, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: Enlightenment brings whatever one desires. I desire to be amused.
quotation.source: Captain Wrack, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "Will the TARDIS still function? The console blew up!"
"Oh, probably did it the world of good."
quotation.source: Tegan and the Doctor, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: You're missing the point. Enlightenment was not the diamond; enlightenment was the choice.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Enlightenment"

quotation.p: "Are you all right?"
"Just a twinge of cosmic angst."
quotation.source: Turlough and the Doctor, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: Not allowed? Me? I'm allowed everywhere!
quotation.source: Doctor #2, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: "I saw it in the Times."
"That's impossible; the man from the Times is still here."
"Tomorrow's Times."
quotation.source: Doctor #2 and Col. Crichton, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: Brigadier, I think our past is catching up with us. Or maybe it's our future.
quotation.source: Doctor #2, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: A man is the sum of his memories, you know, a Time Lord even more so.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: As soon as I found myself in this horrible place, I started looking for you.
quotation.source: Susan, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: "We must know what is happening there."
"Did it occur to you to go and look?"
quotation.source: President Borusa and the Master, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: The cosmos without the Doctor scarcely bears thinking about.
quotation.source: The Master, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: "Whatever's in that tower, it's got enormous powers. What can we do against it?"
"What I've always done, Sarah Jane. Improvise."
quotation.source: Sarah and Doctor #3, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: I knew this would be difficult, but didn't think you would be so stupid as to make it impossible.
quotation.source: The Master, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: "I know you will find this difficult to believe, but this time I mean you no harm."
"Like Alice, I try to believe three impossible things before breakfast."
quotation.source: The Master and the Doctor, in "The Five Doctors"

quotation.p: Ominous, isn't it?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Awakening"

quotation.p: "They burnt the Queen of the May."
"The toast of Little Hodcombe..."
quotation.source: Will and the Doctor, in "The Awakening"

quotation.p: "We're running out of places to run."
"The story of our lives."
quotation.source: Turlough and Tegan, in "The Awakening"

quotation.p: "I quite miss that brown liquid they drink here."
"Ale?"
"No, tea."
quotation.source: Turlough and Will, in "The Awakening"

quotation.p: "What be tea?"
"Oh, a noxious infusion of Oriental leaves containing a high percentage of toxic acid."
quotation.source: Will and the Doctor, in "The Awakening"

quotation.p: Not hat people, are you? Either of you?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Frontios"

quotation.p: I've got another one of these somewhere. Put them side by side, we'll have a pair.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Frontios"

quotation.p: "Systems that could rebuild a civilisation for us. Failure-proof technology."
"What happened to it all?"
"It failed."
quotation.source: Range and the Doctor, in "Frontios"

quotation.p: Now please, come and see the TARDIS. As an invasion weapon it's about as offensive as a chicken vol-au-vent.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Frontios"
