quotation.p: Oh, marvelous... you're going to kill me. What a finely tuned response to the situation!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Frontios"

quotation.p: Rest is for the weary; sleep is for the dead.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Attack of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: "Will it believe you?"
"If it doesn't, I shall beat it into submission with my charm."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Attack of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: You know, Griffiths, when I look at you, I wonder why your ancestors bothered to crawl out of the primordial slime.
quotation.source: Lytton, in "Attack of the Cybermen"

quotation.p: Every time you sound confident nowadays, something terrible seems to happen.
quotation.source: Peri, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: "The rules must be obeyed by both governors as well as prisoners."
"What is the difference?"
quotation.source: The Chief Officer and the Governor, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: "He's the worst governor we've had since... since..."
"Since the last one."
quotation.source: Maldak and Areta, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: "Orthogonal reading is zee ess plus one oh one ee queue."
"'Zee'? Oh, 'zed'."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: We are gathered here today, in the sight of the great video, to ask forgiveness...
quotation.source: A priest, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: "No more executions, torture... nothing."
"It's all changed. We're free."
"Are we?"
"Yes."
"What shall we do?"
"Dunno."
quotation.source: Maldak and Areta, in "Vengeance on Varos"

quotation.p: Circular logic will only make you dizzy, Doctor.
quotation.source: Peri, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: Archimedes... fascinating chap, bit wet...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: Mainly decaying food... and corpses. ... That is the smell of death, Peri; ancient must, heavy in the air... fruit-soft flesh peeling from wet bones... the unholy, unburiable smell of Armageddon. Nothing quite so evocative as one's sense of smell, is there?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: My dear girl, I know a computer when I talk to one.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "Oh, the usual: floor trips, electronic sensors, death rays, jets of nerve gas... nothing to worry about."
"Oh, good; I was afraid it might mean something serious."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Peri, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: I'm not interested in the beliefs of primitives, only in what they taste like.
quotation.source: Shockeye, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "What sort of conspiracy?"
"A plot."
quotation.source: Peri and Jamie, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: Small though it is, the human brain can be quite effective when used properly.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "You look better for your change of clothes and bath. Should try it more often."
"Thank you. What?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Jamie, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "Allowing himself to be captured by the Sontarans -- if anything happens to myself as a result of it, I will never forgive himself."
"I do wish you'd stop switching personal pronouns."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Peri, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "Stand at ease."
"We already were, Stike."
quotation.source: Stike and Chessene, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "I have always had a certain regard for you, Doctor, personally, and the operation will, of necessity, be painful, but --"
"It will hurt you more than it hurts me."
"What gives you that idea?"
quotation.source: Dastari and the Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "I mean human meat, you fawning imbecile!"
"No sir; the nouvelle cuisine has not yet penetrated this establishment."
quotation.source: Shockeye and Oscar, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: Small mammals are quite flavorsome when baked.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Two Doctors"

quotation.p: "Peri, how would you like to meet a genius?"
"I thought I already have."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Peri, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: First things first -- I've a death to arrange.
quotation.source: The Master, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "What is the noun for a collection of geniuses -- a bevy?"
"An inspiration of geniuses? Don't know..."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: You're unbalanced. No wonder the Doctor always outwits you.
quotation.source: The Rani, to the Master, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: You don't get much, do you?
quotation.source: The Master, referring to the Rani's chemical extraction process, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: What's he up to now? It'll be something devious and overcomplicated. He'd get dizzy if he tried to walk in a straight line.
quotation.source: The Rani, about the Master, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "Well, since we're insulting each other, I can't say I care much for your taste in clothes; doesn't do a thing for you."
"Your regeneration's not too attractive, either. But at least I can change my appearance; you're stuck with what you've got."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Rani, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: They're carnivores; what harm have the animals in the fields done them? The rabbits they snare, the sheep they nourish to slaughter -- do they worry about the lesser species when they sink their teeth into a lamb chop?
quotation.source: The Rani, about humans, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "You always did lack style."
"Style is hardly the prime characteristic of your new regeneration."
"Oh, do stop squabbling and get on with it."
quotation.source: The Master, the Doctor, and the Rani, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: A hyperactive Peri -- too ghastly to contemplate.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: You are indeed a worthy opponent, Doctor. It's what gives your destruction its piquancy.
quotation.source: The Master, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: The Rani is a genius. Shame I can't stand her. I wonder if I was particularly nice to her, she might -- nope, no, of course not...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: I've more reason to find him than you have. Otherwise I'm going to spend the rest of my days prancing around in these ridiculous skirts!
quotation.source: Peri, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: Don't move, Peri, don't move! The tree won't hurt you!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "Ugh, your puns get worse."
"Really? I thought they were improving."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "One question, Doctor: what, precisely, do you do in there?"
"Argue, mainly."
quotation.source: Lord Ravensworth and the Doctor, in "Mark of the Rani"

quotation.p: "Is that bad?"
"Bad? No, it's disastrous."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Timelash"

quotation.p: Time Lords do not have a monopoly on the fourth dimension, Doctor.
quotation.source: The Borad, in "Timelash"

quotation.p: Choose your next words carefully, Doctor; they could be your last.
quotation.source: The Borad, in "Timelash"

quotation.p: When I get back to Earth I've got to wow the college with something. My grades certainly won't.
quotation.source: Peri, collecting an alien flower, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Look, if I open that door too soon, the molecular structure of the body will break down, and poor old Stengos will turn into a pool of high-protein water. Even if I were confident I could reconstitute it, we do not have a suitable vessel into which it could be ladled.
quotation.source: Grigory, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: I'm a doctor, not a magician.
quotation.source: Grigory, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "I'm sure Vogel can engage in a little creative accountancy on your behalf."
"I already do. I'm a past master at double entry."
"Then you must make it triple."
quotation.source: Kara and Vogel, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: I have the President's wife out there, and I can tell you that she is far more active now then she ever was when she was alive.
quotation.source: Jobel the mortician, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Well, how do you think I feel? I'm a 900 year old Time Lord. Not much dignity in scrambling over a wall like a small boy on a scrumping spree.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Instant death doesn't bother me; it's the long, lingering kind I'm worried about.
quotation.source: Grigory, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "You forget I'm a doctor. When they slice me open, I'll know the name and function of each organ that pops out."
"Well at least you won't die in ignorance."
quotation.source: Grigory and Natasha, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: America doesn't have a monopoly on bad taste.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: I never thought the precognizance of my own death would be so disturbing.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "You know, if the statue had been made of stone, I doubt if it could have killed you."
"Really?"
"It would take a mountain to crush an ego like yours."
quotation.source: Jobel and the Doctor, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Those rose-red ruby lips were made for kissing."
"But not by you!"
quotation.source: Jobel and Peri, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: A Knight of the Grand Order of Oberon... only I would be stupid enough to attack such a person.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "May I ask what you're doing here?"
"You may, but only a fool would expect an answer."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Orsini, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "I see you have been busy."
"Whereas you have been stupid, Doctor."
"Prerogative of a Time Lord."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Davros, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "But did you bother to tell anyone they might be eating their own relatives?
"Certainly not. That would have created what I believe is termed 'consumer resistance'."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Davros, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: No more words.
quotation.source: Orsini's last words, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "I know somewhere that is truly tranquil... peaceful... restful... a panacea for the cares of mind."
"Can't we go somewhere fun?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Peri, in "Revelation of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Why would they want to control the tide?"
"Well, they... er... why not?"
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: "Do you think this wise, Doctor?"
"My dear girl, if I stopped to question the wisdom of my actions I'd never have left Gallifrey."
"Sometimes I wish you hadn't."
quotation.source: Peri and the Doctor, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: Just like in the old days... nothing more enjoyable than watching people suffer!
quotation.source: Sil, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: Destiny? Isn't that just a fancy name for blind chance?
quotation.source: Peri, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: "Nice to know that you can be relied upon to be your usual treacherous self."
"I endeavour to maintain a certain continuity."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Sil, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: "You won't convict me by using shock tactics."
"I require nothing so crude, my dear Doctor. All that will prove necessary is the truth."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Valeyard, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: "What about your companion, Doctor?"
"Oh, Peri? Quite unsuitable: silly, female, flibbertigibbet... hopeless!"
quotation.source: Crozier and the Doctor, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: "His name is Dorf, and you are scum!"
"No, actually I'm known as the Doctor."
quotation.source: Yrcanos and the Doctor, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: Everyone has a "point" nowadays. I am a man of action, not reason!
quotation.source: Yrcanos, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: You think like a warrior but you do not act like one; it's most perplexing...
quotation.source: Yrcanos, to the Doctor, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: We shall release the slaves, and then on to death!
quotation.source: Yrcanos, in "Mindwarp"

quotation.p: I'm as truthful, honest, and about as boring as they come.
quotation.source: Mel, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: Here the only logic is that there isn't any logic.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: It takes time, Doctor, but eventually you get there.
quotation.source: The Master, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: In all my travellings through the universe, I have battled against evil, against power-mad conspirators. I should have stayed here! The oldest civilization: decadent, degenerate, and rotten to the core. Power-mad conspirators, Daleks, Sontarans, Cybermen; they're still in the nursery compared to us. Ten million years of absolute power, that's what it takes to be really corrupt!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: I knew this was a mistake; my grip on reality's not too good at the best of times.
quotation.source: Glitz, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: There is nothing purer and more unsullied, Madam, than the desire for revenge, but, if you follow the metaphor, I've thrown a pebble into the water, perhaps killing two birds with one stone and causing ripples that will rock the High Council to its foundations.
quotation.source: The Master, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: This is a very odd waiting room. Where are the hopelessly out-of-date magazines?
quotation.source: The Doctor, standing in the middle of a desert, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: Great cosmic protector of grafters and dissemblers, save me! Save meee!
quotation.source: Glitz, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: You cannot speak as though reality is a one-dimensional concept.
quotation.source: The Valeyard, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: There are times in our relationship when I feel an interpreter wouldn't come amiss.
quotation.source: Mel, to the Doctor, in "The Ultimate Foe"

quotation.p: "It seems pretty far gone; need a genius to unravel it..."
"But Doctor, you're a genius!"
"Oh yes, I definitely remember that."
quotation.source: The amnesiac Doctor and the Rani, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: I'm as fit as a trombone.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: A bad workman always blames his fools.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: ... like a bull in a barber shop.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: You don't understand regeneration, Mel; it's a lottery, and I've drawn the short plank.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: The more I know me, the less I like me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: "A little portentous, perhaps, Mel?"
<sotto voce> "'Pretentious' is the word."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the Rani, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: Thank goodness in this regeneration I've regained my impeccable sense of haute couture.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: Absence makes the nose grow longer.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: More hasta, less vista.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: The proof of the pumpkin is in the squeezing.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: And I'm suffering from post-regeneration amnesia, as far as I can remember.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: "You must be the Doctor. I've met your companion Mel."
"Don't hold that against me."
quotation.source: Ikona and the Doctor, in "Time and the Rani"

quotation.p: "Are these old ladies annoying you?"
"No!"
"Are you annoying these old ladies?"
quotation.source: Pex and Mel, in "Paradise Towers"

quotation.p: No cause for panic? Two of my next-door neighbours have just disappeared down the waste disposal chute!
quotation.source: Maddy, in "Paradise Towers"

quotation.p: "Don't you think it's wonderful to be somewhere calm and clean and relaxing?"
"It makes me nervous."
quotation.source: Mel and Pex, in "Paradise Towers"

quotation.p: "Fact is, I'm on a mission of highly philanthropic nature."
"What's that?"
"It means it's beneficial to mankind."
"I know what 'philanthropic' means! What's the mission?"
quotation.source: Glitz and Mel, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: "The money?"
"Gone the way of all organic matter I'm afraid; down the tubes."
quotation.source: Belsz and Glitz, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: It was only a small explosion. They couldn't understand how blowing up the art room was a creative act.
quotation.source: Ace, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: Right, freeze! I mean, don't freeze, I mean stand still!
quotation.source: Ace, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: Do you feel like arguing with a can of deodorant that registers 9 on the Richter Scale?
quotation.source: Ace, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: If he was a mortician, the corpses would keep their eyes open.
quotation.source: Glitz, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: "Excuse me, what's your attitude towards the nature of existence? For example, do you hold any strong theological opinions?"
"I think you'll find that most educated people regard mythical convictions as fundamentally animistic."
"I see; that's a very interesting concept."
"Personally, I find most experiences border on the existential."
quotation.source: The Doctor and a guard, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: "What are you doing here?"
"That's a very difficult question. Why is everyone around here so preoccupied with metaphysics?"
quotation.source: Belsz and the Doctor, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: "I think she's going to kill us, Doctor."
"Ah, an existentialist!"
quotation.source: Glitz and the Doctor, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: Funny old business, time; it delights in frustrating your plans.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: That's right, yes, you're going. Gone for ages. Already gone. Still here. Just arrived. Haven't even met you. It all depends on who you are and how you look at it. Strange business, time.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: Think about me, when you're living your life, one day after another, all in a neat pattern. Think about the oldest traveller and his old police box, his days like crazy paving.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Dragonfire"

quotation.p: "Give me an A-flat."
"Eh?"
"No, A-flat."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Earl Sigma, in "The Happiness Patrol"

quotation.p: I don't believe you've met my young friend Ace, an expert in calorification, incineration, carbonization, and inflammation.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Happiness Patrol"

quotation.p: I'm finding this rather tiresome.
quotation.source: The Kandyman, in "The Happiness Patrol"

quotation.p: I can hear the sound of empires toppling.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Happiness Patrol"

quotation.p: "What am I dealing with? Little green men?"
"No -- little green blobs in bonded polycarbide armour."
quotation.source: Gilmore and the Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Ace, give me some of that Nitro-9 you're not carrying!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: You can judge a man by the quality of his enemies.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Your species has the most amazing capacity for self-deception, matched only by its ingenuity when trying to destroy itself.
quotation.source: The Doctor, on humans, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: Good place to put things, cellars.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: I wasn't wandering the streets. I was merely contemplating certain local cartographic anomalies.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Small human female sighted on level three."
"Who're you calling 'small'?"
quotation.source: A Dalek and Ace, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "It's called that because Time Lords have an infinite capacity for pretension."
"Noticed that."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "The Hand of Omega is a mythical name for Omega's remote stellar manipulator, a device used to customize stars with. And didn't we have trouble with the prototype..."
"'They'."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "The Daleks shall become Lords of Time! We shall become all--"
"--powerful! Crush the lesser races! Conquer the galaxy! Unimaginable power! Unlimited rice pudding! Et cetera! Et cetera!"
quotation.source: Davros and the Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Doctor, we did good, didn't we?"
"Perhaps. Time will tell. Always does."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Remembrance of the Daleks"

quotation.p: "Who'd want to kill us?"
"There's an infinite number of possibilities."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: "When I employed you, you led me to believe you were a hardened criminal."
"As My Lady knows, before I entered your service I was found guilty of a large number of offenses."
"Then have the courage of your convictions. Drink."
quotation.source: Lady Peinforte and Richard, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: "Was that a bomb?"
"No. That was the return to Earth of a comet called Nemesis that has been in orbit for exactly 350 years."
"You're amazing, Professor, being able to tell all that just from the noise."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: "This may qualify as the worst miscalculation since life crawled out of the seas on this sad planet."
"Well, nobody's perfect."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: I'll tell you 350 years ago.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: This is no madness; 'tis England.
quotation.source: Lady Peinforte, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: Come! the bear will not pursue us; such things happen only in the theatre.
quotation.source: Lady Peinforte, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: "I don't suppose you've completely ignored my instructions and secretly prepared any Nitro-9, have you?"
"What if I had?"
"And naturally, you wouldn't do anything so insanely dangerous as to carry it around with you, would you."
"Of course not. I'm a good girl and do what I'm told."
"Excellent. Blow up that vehicle."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: Hello! I'm the Doctor. I believe you want to kill me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: "Yes, there was a Dorothea; she died in sixteen --"
"-- twenty-one. 'Twas a slow poison."
"This is unbelievable."
"Many found it so."
quotation.source: Mrs Remington and Lady Peinforte, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: It is only my present form. I have had others which would horrify you. I shall have them again.
quotation.source: Nemesis, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: I am whatever I am made to be. This time Lady Peinforte called me Nemesis, so I am retribution.
quotation.source: Nemesis, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: Things are still imperfect.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Silver Nemesis"

quotation.p: You're just an aging hippie, Professor.
quotation.source: Ace, to the Doctor, in "The Greatest Show in the Galaxy"

quotation.p: "Would you like to see the future?"
"Not just yet."
quotation.source: Morgana and the Doctor, in "The Greatest Show in the Galaxy"

quotation.p: "You have to hang up your travelling shoes and stop wandering sooner or later, don't you?"
"So I've been told. Personally, I just keep on wandering."
quotation.source: Morgana and the Doctor, in "The Greatest Show in the Galaxy"

quotation.p: #1 rule of the intergalactic explorer, Doctor: if you hear somebody talking about "good vibes" and "letting it all hang out", run a mile.
quotation.source: Captain Cook, in "The Greatest Show in the Galaxy"

quotation.p: Anybody remotely interesting is mad in some way or another.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Greatest Show in the Galaxy"

quotation.p: The point of archaeology is to carefully recover the past, not disintegrate it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Sir, we don't know what the situation is here!"
"The situation, Lavel, is normal, and it doesn't get much worse than that. You know, I'm rather enjoying this."
quotation.source: Lavel and the Brigadier, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Ace, I think it's time for plan B..."
"We run?"
"Yes! RUN!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: Don't worry, Brigadier, people will be shooting at you soon enough...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "What are you doing in the lake?"
"Drowning."
quotation.source: Brigadier Bambera and Ace, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Ancelyn, in this world we have a great and honourable tradition of tactical withdrawal."
"Ah, you wish to run away. Well, there can be but thirty of them at the most."
quotation.source: Brigadier Bambera and Ancelyn, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Ace, things may get dangerous, so I want you to have this."
"It looks like a piece of chalk."
"It is. I got it from the dart board."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: High drama is very similar to comedy; it's all a matter of timiiiiiiing...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "You haven't won the game yet, Morgaine."
"I could always defeat you at chess, Merlin."
"Who said anything about playing chess? I've been playing poker. And I have an Ace up my sleeve..."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Morgaine, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Nice work, Doctor."
"Well, I thought she was bluffing!"
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, as the Destroyer is freed, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "What was that?"
"That, Brigadier, was the beginning of the end of the world."
"Same as ever, eh, Doctor?"
quotation.source: The Brigadier and the Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Pitiful. Can this world do no better than you as its champion?"
"Probably. I just do the best I can."
quotation.source: The Destroyer and the Brigadier, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: You stupid stubborn thickheaded numbskull, you were supposed to die in bed! I could have handled it...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: Ace, I'm getting too old for this sort of thing. He's all yours from now on... I'm going home to Doris.
quotation.source: The Brigadier, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Ace, have you no sense of occasion?"
"No."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: I ought to have given myself more warning.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: Time and Time Lords wait for no man.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Battlefield"

quotation.p: "Don't you find the Commander's orders peculiar sometimes, soldier?"
"Peculiar or not, orders is orders."
quotation.source: The Doctor and a soldier, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: And the half-time score: Perivale: 600 million; rest of the universe: nil.
quotation.source: Ace, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: "Objects can't harm us, it's human belief. And you stopped believing when the bombs started falling."
"I'm not frightened of German bombs."
"Not German bombs; British, falling on German cities."
quotation.source: The vampiric Phyllis and Rev Wainwright, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: I'm not an invalid, I'm a cripple. I'm also a genius, so shut up, the pair of you!
quotation.source: Dr Judson, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: If you want a job done properly, get a girl to do it. Out of the way, boys!
quotation.source: Ace, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: "Another explosion might bring the roof down on top of our heads."
"Oh, just a small one?"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: Ah, the sound of dying... When it comes to death, quantity is so much more satisfying than quality.
quotation.source: Dr Judson/Fenric, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: Don't interrupt me when I'm eulogizing.
quotation.source: Dr Judson/Fenric, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: Thousands of years in the future, the Earth lays dying, the surface just a chemical slime. Half a million years of industrial progress...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Curse of Fenric"

quotation.p: "Don't you have things you hate?"
"I can't stand burnt toast. I loathe bus stations, terrible places, full of lost luggage and lost souls."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: I'm not interested in money. <pause> How much?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: Oh, don't worry; I always leave things till the last moment.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "You're so smug and self-satisfied, Doctor."
"I try."
quotation.source: Josiah and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: After this I'll get a job at Sellafield; it'll be safer.
quotation.source: Ace, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: Just do what I do when I do it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "At the season when ice floods swamped the pasturelands, we herded the mammoths sunwards to find new grazing."
"Tricky things, mammoths."
quotation.source: Nimrod and Inspector Mackenzie, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: Now the wild world is lost, in a desert of smoke and straight lines.
quotation.source: Nimrod, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "Where's Nimrod?"
"He's gone to see a man about a god."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: All civilisation starts with hunting and foraging, but don't worry, you'll soon work your way up.
quotation.source: The Doctor, soliloquizing to a beetle, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "Doctor, you are as powerful as you are wise."
"Cut the homespun twaddle, Nimrod. It's not wise. I've lit the blue touch paper and found there's nowhere to retire to."
quotation.source: Nimrod and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "I once spent centuries, faithfully cataloguing every species there, every organism from the smallest bacterium to the largest ichthyosaur. But as soon as I'd finished, the whole world started changing."
"That's life."
quotation.source: Light and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: Things are getting out of control; even I can't play this many games at once!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: I know you. I took you up as the last specimen of the extinct Neanderthal race from Earth. ... At least they knew when to stop evolving.
quotation.source: Light, to Nimrod, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: Hate world. Hate freeness, it bites!
quotation.source: Control, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: When you're a kid, you smash things you hate. But what do I do if it keeps coming back?
quotation.source: Ace, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: I could forgive her those little trips to Java ... if she didn't enjoy them so much.
quotation.source: The Doctor, about Gwendoline, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: And I don't think much about your catalogue. It's full of gaps. ... What about the gryphons? Basilisks? You missed the dragons, the bandersnatches. And then there are the slithy toves, and the crowned Saxe-Coburg. ... I can't think how you missed them.
quotation.source: The Doctor, to Light, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "You are endlessly agitating, unceasingly mischievous. Will you never stop?"
"I suppose I could; it would make a change."
quotation.source: Light and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "So I burnt the house down."
"Any regrets?"
"Yes. I wish I'd blown it up instead!"
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Ghost Light"

quotation.p: "You had to pick a Sunday, didn't you? You bring me back to the boredom capital of the universe, and you pick the one day of the week you can't even get a decent television programme."
quotation.source: Ace, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "So what's so terrible about Perivale?"
"Nothing ever happens here."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Ace, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "How long since I was here?"
"You've been away as long as you think you have."
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: He doesn't have to outrun the lion, only his friend. Then the lion catches up with his friend and eats him. The strong survive, the weak are killed: the law of the jungle! ... Yes, very clever, if you don't mind losing your friend. But what happens when the next lion turns up? I think you'd better get your running shoes on, gentlemen.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "I'm sure I've forgotten something."
"Oi, haven't you forgotten something?"
"Yes?"
"Money."
"No, it wasn't that."
quotation.source: The Doctor and the storekeeper, in "Survival"

quotation.p: That was what they said; either you were dead or you had gone to Birmingham.
quotation.source: Ange, in "Survival"

quotation.p: Not a very efficient way to hunt, is it? All that noise and pantomime just to slaughter one little animal. No, if you're going to hunt, you stalk your prey, you observe it so you can take it by surprise, and then you don't kill too many, cover your tracks, so you don't leave a smell. Can you smell that?
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: When is a cat not a cat? When it builds a cat-flap...
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: This is Derek. Been doing very well; he's been here three weeks and only got flesh wounds.
quotation.source: Midge, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "You follow me and I'll get us through this. I'm a hunting animal; I've got the instinct for it."
"Oh, do shut up."
quotation.source: Sergeant Patterson and the Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "Master? Who's he?"
"An evil genius. My oldest, deadliest of enemies."
"Do you know any nice people? You know, ordinary people? Not power- crazed nutters trying to take over the galaxy?"
quotation.source: Ace and the Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: Do you bleed? I can always do something to you, if you bleed.
quotation.source: Karra, to the Master, in "Survival"

quotation.p: "It seems we must always meet again."
"They do say opposites attract."
quotation.source: The Master and the Doctor, in "Survival"

quotation.p: There are worlds out there where the sky is burning, and the sea is asleep, and the rivers dream. People made of smoke and cities made of song. Somewhere there's danger, somewhere there's injustice, somewhere else the tea's getting cold. Come on, Ace; we've got work to do!
quotation.source: The Doctor's final words, in "Survival"

quotation.p: A Time Lord has thirteen lives, and the Master had used all of his. But rules never meant much to him. So I stowed his remains safely for the voyage back, because even in death I couldn't trust him.
quotation.source: The Doctor's voice-over, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: I am not Bruce. It took me a minute, with the talking and the walking, but I am not Bruce.
quotation.source: The Master, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: "Yes!"
"What?!?"
"These shoes! They fit perfectly!"
quotation.source: The Doctor and Grace, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: "See? I told you it was small."
"What is it they say?"
"Yes, they say that on my planet, too."
quotation.source: The Doctor and Grace, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: Is this thing reliable?
quotation.source: Grace, asking about the TARDIS, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: This is no time to play doctors and nurses.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: What a sentimental old thing this TARDIS is!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "The Enemy Within"

quotation.p: I never make stupid mistakes. Only very, very clever ones.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in Timewyrm: Genesys

quotation.p: "Mastery of English?" Well, I'd reverse the roles, personally: it's English that has mastered me.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "...ish"

quotation.p: He loves language. Which is great, but it blows poetic and pedantic at times.
quotation.source: Peri, on the Doctor, in "...ish"

quotation.p: When will violent death ever make sense? We only make what we can, Cawdry, from that which surrounds it.
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "...ish"

quotation.p: Oh, circumlocute this!
quotation.source: The Doctor, in "...ish"
